#### Space-time covariography

Create spacetime object from aws

```{r}
library(spacetime)
aws <- aws[, ":="(DATE=as.Date(DATE)),]
aws.st <- stConstruct(aws, space=c('LONGITUDE','LATITUDE'), time='DATE', SpatialObj=SpatialPoints(aws[,c('LONGITUDE','LATITUDE')]), crs=CRS("+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84"))
aws.st <- as(aws.st,'STFDF')
```

Spatial autocorrelation for one single date

```{r}
library(gstat)
date <- '2022-08-03'

v <- variogram(TMIN~1, 
               aws.st[!is.na(aws.st[,date,'TMIN']$TMIN),
                      date,'TMIN'],
               cutoff=20,
               width=1)
plot(v, main='TMIN')

v <- variogram(tcc~1, 
               aws.st[!is.na(aws.st[,date,'tcc']$tcc),
                      date,'tcc'],
               cutoff=20,
               width=1)
plot(v, main='tcc')

v <- variogram(dem~1, 
               aws.st[!is.na(aws.st[,date,'dem']$dem),
                      date,'dem'],
               cutoff=30,
               width=2)
plot(v, main='dem')
```

Mean variogram on multiple dates

```{r}
lst <- lapply(1:90,function(i){x=aws.st[,i,"TMIN"]; x$ti=i ; rownames(x@coords)=NULL;x})
pts <- do.call(rbind,lst)
vv <- variogram(TMIN~ti, 
                pts[!is.na(pts$TMIN),],
                cutoff=50,
                width=2)
plot(vv, main="TMIN")
```

Space-time semi-variogram

```{r}
vvst <- variogram(TMIN~1,
                  aws.st[!is.na(aws.st[,,"TMIN"]$TMIN),,"TMIN"],
                  width=5, 
                  cutoff=80,
                  tlags=0:8)
plot(vvst, main='TMIN')
plot(vvst, main='TMIN', map=FALSE)

vvst <- variogram(TMAX~1,
                  aws.st[!is.na(aws.st[,,"TMAX"]$TMAX),,"TMAX"],
                  width=5, 
                  cutoff=80,
                  tlags=0:8)
plot(vvst, main='TMAX')
plot(vvst, main='TMAX', map=FALSE)
```

PCA

```{r}
library(factoextra)
res.pca <- prcomp(aws[DATE=='2022-06-02',.(dem, imp, tcc, build.fp, TX12am, TN12am)], scale = TRUE)
fviz_eig(res.pca)

fviz_pca_ind(res.pca, geom='point', alpha=0.5)
fviz_pca_var(res.pca,
             col.var = "contrib", # Color by contributions to the PC
             gradient.cols = c("#00AFBB", "#E7B800", "#FC4E07"),
             repel = TRUE     # Avoid text overlapping
             )

fviz_pca_biplot(res.pca, repel = TRUE,
                col.var = "#2E9FDF", # Variables color
                col.ind = "#696969",  # Individuals color
                geom='point'
                )

```

Kmeans on prediction grid

```{r}
library(terra)
library(data.table)
grid.spat <- vect('../input/prediction_grid_points_urb_rur_spatialcov.shp')
grid.spat$lon <- geom(grid.spat)[,'x']
grid.spat$lat <- geom(grid.spat)[,'y']
grid.spat <- setDT(as.data.frame(grid.spat))
dim(grid.spat)
```

Crops and water bodies are set to tcc==0 and imp==0

Shouldn't we create another variable such as 'degree of vegetalization' instead of tcc? Or height of vegetation?

```{r}

dt.plot <- grid.spat[,.(imp=as.numeric(imp), tcc=as.numeric(tcc), dem=as.numeric(dem), build.fp=as.numeric(build.fp), build.h=build.h, lon=as.numeric(lon), lat=as.numeric(lat)),]

ggplot(dt.plot[imp==0 & tcc==0,,])+
  geom_point(aes(x=lon, y=lat), size=0.01)+
  coord_equal()
```

```{r}
library(factoextra)
set.seed(123)

data.cluster <- dt.plot[, .(imp, build.fp/9, tcc, dem)]
data.cluster <- scale(data.cluster)

# nb clusters
fviz_nbclust(data.cluster[1:20000,], kmeans, method = "silhouette")

res.km <- kmeans(data.cluster, 5)
fviz_cluster(res.km, data = data.cluster,
             palette = c("#2E9FDF", "#00AFBB", "#E7B800", 'orange', 'red'), 
             geom = "point",
             ellipse.type = "convex", 
             ggtheme = theme_bw(),
             alpha=0.1
             )

dt.plot$cluster <- res.km$cluster
ggplot(dt.plot)+
  geom_point(aes(x=lon, y=lat, color=as.factor(cluster)), size=0.01)+
  scale_color_manual(values=c("#2E9FDF", "yellow", "green", 'purple', 'red'))+
  coord_equal()

```
